H0.text: Hardness is the physical property used to identify a mineral based on its resistance to being scratched.

H1.text: Density is the physical property used to identify a mineral based on its resistance to being scratched.

H2.text: Color is the physical property used to identify a mineral based on its resistance to being scratched.

H3.text: Streak is the physical property used to identify a mineral based on its resistance to being scratched.

A4.text: The Mohs scale of mineral hardness is based on the ability of one natural sample of mineral to visibly scratch another mineral.
